In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is an example of how you can write the `clean_column` function in Julia:
```
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]+", "_")
end
```
This function takes a string argument `col`, which represents the column name to be cleaned. It first lowercases the string using the `lowercase` function, then removes any leading or trailing whitespaces using the `strip` function. Finally, it replaces any spaces and hyphens with an underscore using the `replace` function with a regular expression pattern that matches one or more spaces or hyphens (`[ -]+`). The resulting cleaned column name is returned as a string.

Here's an example usage of the `clean_column` function:
```
julia> col = "My Column"
"My Column"

julia> clean_column(col)
"my_column"
```
